abstract: Prosecutors used e-mails and phone calls to suggest that Rajat K. Gupta, a former director at Goldman Sachs and Procter & Gamble, was close friends with Raj Rajaratnam, who was convicted of insider trading last year.
snippet: Prosecutors used e-mails and phone calls to suggest that Rajat K. Gupta, a former director at Goldman Sachs and Procter & Gamble, was close friends with Raj Rajaratnam, who was convicted of insider trading last year.
lead_paragraph: If he had his druthers, Rajat K. Gupta would have been in Cambridge, Mass., on Thursday, attending his daughter’s graduation from Harvard Business School. Instead, Mr. Gupta was seated at the defense table in Judge Jed S. Rakoff’s courtroom in Manhattan, on trial on insider trading charges.

headline.main: Prosecutors Seek to Show Gupta’s Close Ties to Rajaratnam

byline.original: By Peter Lattman and William Alden
